revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Hitron |model=CGNV |revision=1A |asin= |fcc_date=09/09/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf= |availability=common |type=wireless router, cable modem, analog phone gateway |fcc_id=U4P-CGNV1A |ic_id= |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=C7P |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz=60 |cpu1_brand=Intel Puma |cpu1_model=DNCE2500GU |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand=Ralink |cpu2_model=RT3883 |cpu2_cspeed=500 |fla1=32 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model= |fla1_num=2 |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU64M16GG-AC |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, USB 2.0, |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Alpha Networks WMP-N14 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3883 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8316 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=Digital Cable Front-End Receiver;MaxLinear;MxL261;;1; |flags=DOCSIS 3.0 |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=HITRON-XXXX |default_ssid_regex=^HITRON-[A-F0-9]{4}$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=cusadmin |default_pass=password |oui=68:B6:FC |oui_eth=68:B6:FC }} {{TagLine|Wireless DOCSIS 3.0 Modem Router}} :[http://www.hitron-americas.com/products/cgnv-2/ Product page]
This is a 8x4 device.<!--
-->{{CableModemSpec |down_c=8 |up_c=4 }}
Per the FCC photos... *"PN:382208100202-10" is silkscreened on the RT3883 module: :WiSoC: [[Ralink]] RT3883 @500MHz 3T3R (iNIC) :RAM: ''EtronTech'' EM639165TS-6G (16MB) :using one ''Airgain'' N2420DS antenna and two other higher gain antennas *The device is using a [http://www.maxlinear.com/press-release-02-15-11/ ''MaxLinear'' MxL261] :(Multi-Channel Tuner-Demodulator Single-Chip Front-End IC)
The battery in use is a '''Getec Technology Corp''' BP-LC2200/31-A0002 S :(11.1V, 24Wh, Li-Ion, Assembled in China, Cells from Japan).
The FCC test report specifies the PSU as an '''AOEM''' A036115-F81 :(100-240VAC ~ 60Hz, 1A -> 15VDC, 2.4A)..
Default settings, SSID, and OUI info is per the FCC EUT's label. :They may be completely wrong.
See also [[SMC SMCD3GNV3]]..
